definition: Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: Wang Fuzhi s Shuo Wen Guang Yi focuses on changes of morphology and semantic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 王夫之《說文廣義》着眼詞的形義變化。

sentences.english: Wang Fuzhi was the synthesizer of ideologies of body philosophy in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 王夫之乃中國古代身體哲學思想的集其大成者。

sentences.english: Wang Fuzhi reconstructs the Confucius' theory of nature and destiny on the ground of the view of reason and Qi.
sentences.chinese: 王夫之以理氣觀爲基礎，對孔子的天命論進行改造。

sentences.english: The biography was written by Wang Fuzhi, a great thinker of the seventeenth century.
sentences.chinese: 其中方密之先生傳由十七世紀著名思想家王夫之所作。

sentences.english: Therefore, Jang Fuzhi's esthetical image theory profoundly contains a value of metaphysics.
sentences.chinese: 王夫之審美意象說蘊含深邃的價值形而上學色彩。

sentences.english: Therefore, Wang Fuzhi's esthetical image theory profoundly contains a value of metaphysics.
sentences.chinese: 王夫之審美意象說蘊含深邃的價值形而上學色彩。

sentences.english: Confucius and Wang Fu-zhih are two great thinkers in China.
sentences.chinese: 孔子和王夫之是中國歷史上兩位偉大的思想家。

definition: Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
Wei Yuan (1794-1857), Qing dynasty thinker, historian and scholar
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Wang Guowei (1877-1927), noted scholar
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
Zhao Yi (1727-1814), Qing dynasty poet and historian, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Gong Zizhen (1792-1841), Chinese man of letters, calligrapher and poet
Hong Liangji (1746-1809), poet and historian
Yuan Hongdao (1568-1610), Ming dynasty poet and travel writer
Jia Yi (200-168 BC), Chinese poet and statesman of the Western Han Dynasty
Zhang Pu (1602-1641), Ming dynasty scholar and prolific writer, proponent of 複社|复社[fu4 she4] cultural renewal movement, author of Five tombstone inscriptions 五人墓碑記|五人墓碑记[wu3 ren2 mu4 bei1 ji4]
Dai Mingshi (1653-1713), early Qing writer
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist
